publications.description: metadata records about research literature (includes types of publications listed here).

schema.authors: STRUCT(fullName VARCHAR, "name" VARCHAR, surname VARCHAR, rank BIGINT, pid STRUCT(id STRUCT(scheme VARCHAR, "value" VARCHAR), provenance STRUCT(provenance VARCHAR, trust VARCHAR)))[]
schema.countries: STRUCT(code VARCHAR, "label" VARCHAR, provenance STRUCT(provenance VARCHAR, trust VARCHAR))[]
schema.subjects: STRUCT(subject STRUCT(scheme VARCHAR, "value" VARCHAR), provenance STRUCT(provenance VARCHAR, trust VARCHAR))[]
schema.subTitle: VARCHAR
schema.container: STRUCT("name" VARCHAR, issnPrinted VARCHAR, issnOnline VARCHAR, issnLinking VARCHAR, ep VARCHAR, iss VARCHAR, sp VARCHAR, vol VARCHAR, edition VARCHAR, conferencePlace VARCHAR, conferenceDate DATE)
schema.indicators: STRUCT(citationImpact STRUCT(citationCount BIGINT, influence DOUBLE, popularity DOUBLE, impulse BIGINT, citationClass VARCHAR, influenceClass VARCHAR, impulseClass VARCHAR, popularityClass VARCHAR), usageCounts STRUCT(downloads BIGINT, "views" BIGINT))
schema.instances: STRUCT(license VARCHAR, "type" VARCHAR, urls VARCHAR[], publicationDate DATE, refereed VARCHAR, alternateIdentifiers STRUCT(scheme VARCHAR, "value" VARCHAR)[], accessRight STRUCT(code VARCHAR, "label" VARCHAR, scheme VARCHAR, openAccessRoute VARCHAR), pids STRUCT(scheme VARCHAR, "value" VARCHAR)[], articleProcessingCharge STRUCT(currency VARCHAR, amount VARCHAR))[]
schema.projects: STRUCT(id VARCHAR, code VARCHAR, acronym VARCHAR, title VARCHAR, callIdentifier VARCHAR, fundings STRUCT(fundingStream STRUCT(description VARCHAR, id VARCHAR), jurisdiction VARCHAR, name VARCHAR, shortName VARCHAR)[], granted STRUCT(currency VARCHAR, fundedAmount DOUBLE, totalCost double), h2020Programmes STRUCT(code VARCHAR, description VARCHAR)[], keywords VARCHAR, openAccessMandateForDataset BOOLEAN, openAccessMandateForPublications BOOLEAN, startDate DATE, endDate DATE, subjects VARCHAR[], summary VARCHAR, websiteUrl VARCHAR)[]
schema.organizations: STRUCT(legalName VARCHAR, acronym VARCHAR, id VARCHAR, pids STRUCT(scheme VARCHAR, "value" VARCHAR)[])[]
schema.communities: STRUCT(code VARCHAR, "label" VARCHAR, provenance STRUCT(provenance VARCHAR, trust DOUBLE)[])[]

column-descriptions.authors: The main researchers involved in producing the data, or the authors of the publication.
column-descriptions.openAccessColor: Indicates the specific open access model used for the publication; possible value is one of bronze, gold, hybrid.
column-descriptions.publiclyFunded: Discloses whether the publication acknowledges grants from public sources.
column-descriptions.type: Type of the research products. Possible types: publication, data, software, other as declared in the terms from the [dnet:result_typologies vocabulary](https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:result_typologies).
column-descriptions.language: The alpha-3/ISO 639-2 code of the language. Values controlled by the [dnet:languages vocabulary](https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:languages).
column-descriptions.countries: Country associated with the research product: it is the country of the organisation that manages the institutional repository or national aggregator or CRIS system from which this record was collected. Country of affiliations of authors can be found instead in the affiliation relation.
column-descriptions.subjects: Subject, keyword, classification code, or key phrase describing the resource. OpenAIRE classifies research products according to the [Field of Science](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/graph-production-workflow/indicators-ingestion/fos-classification) and [Sustainable Development Goals](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/graph-production-workflow/indicators-ingestion/sdg-classification) taxonomies. Check out the relative sections to know more.
column-descriptions.mainTitle: A name or title by which a research product is known. It may be the title of a publication or the name of a piece of software.
column-descriptions.subTitle: Explanatory or alternative name by which a research product is known.
column-descriptions.descriptions: A brief description of the resource and the context in which the resource was created.
column-descriptions.publicationDate: Main date of the research product: typically the publication or issued date. In case of a research product with different versions with different dates, the date of the research product is selected as the most frequent well-formatted date. If not available, then the most recent and complete date among those that are well-formatted. For statistics, the year is extracted and the research product is counted only among the research products of that year. Example: Pre-print date: 2019-02-03, Article date provided by repository: 2020-02, Article date provided by Crossref: 2020, OpenAIRE will set as date 2019-02-03, because it’s the most recent among the complete and well-formed dates. If then the repository updates the metadata and set a complete date (e.g. 2020-02-12), then this will be the new date for the research product because it becomes the most recent most complete date. However, if OpenAIRE then collects the pre-print from another repository with date 2019-02-03, then this will be the “winning date” because it becomes the most frequent well-formatted date.
column-descriptions.publisher: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the resource.
column-descriptions.embargoEndDate: Date when the embargo ends and this research product turns Open Access.
column-descriptions.sources: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. See definition of Dublin Core field [dc:source](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/elements11/source).
column-descriptions.formats: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.
column-descriptions.contributors: The institution or person responsible for collecting, managing, distributing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the resource.
column-descriptions.bestAccessRight: The most open access right associated to the manifestations of this research product.
column-descriptions.container: Container has information about the conference or journal where the research product has been presented or published.
column-descriptions.id: Main entity identifier, created according to the OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy.
column-descriptions.originalIds: Identifiers of the record at the original sources.
column-descriptions.pids: Persistent identifiers of the research product. See also the [OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/pids-and-identifiers) to learn more.
column-descriptions.dateOfCollection: When OpenAIRE collected the record the last time.
column-descriptions.lastUpdateTimeStamp: Timestamp of last update of the record in OpenAIRE in ms since epoch.
column-descriptions.indicators: The indicators computed for this research product; currently, the following types of indicators are supported: [Citation-based impact indicators by BIP!](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/entities/other#citationimpact), [Usage Statistics indicators](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/entities/other#usagecounts)
column-descriptions.instances: Specific materialization or version of the research product. For example, you can have one research product with three instances: one is the pre-print, one is the post-print, one is the published version.
column-descriptions.isGreen: Indicates whether or not the scientific result was published following the green open access model.
column-descriptions.isInDiamondJournal: Indicates whether or not the publication was published in a diamond journal.
column-descriptions.projects: List of projects (i.e. grants) that (co-)funded the production of the research products.
column-descriptions.organizations: Organizations include companies, research centers or institutions involved as project partners or as responsible of operating data sources. Information about organizations are collected from funder databases like CORDA, registries of data sources like OpenDOAR and re3Data, and CRIS systems, as being related to projects or data sources.
column-descriptions.communities: Reference to relevant research infrastructure, initiative or communities (RI/RC) among those collaborating with OpenAIRE. Please see https://connect.openaire.eu that are publicly visible.
column-descriptions.collectedfrom: Information about the sources from which the record has been collected.

datasets.description: Metadata records about research data (includes the subtypes listed here).

column-descriptions.isInDiamondJournal: Indicates whether or not the publication was published in a diamond journal.
column-descriptions.projects: List of projects (i.e. grants) that (co-)funded the production of the research products.
column-descriptions.organizations: Organizations include companies, research centers or institutions involved as project partners or as responsible of operating data sources. Information about organizations are collected from funder databases like CORDA, registries of data sources like OpenDOAR and re3Data, and CRIS systems, as being related to projects or data sources.
column-descriptions.communities: Reference to relevant research infrastructure, initiative or communities (RI/RC) among those collaborating with OpenAIRE. Please see https://connect.openaire.eu that are publicly visible.
column-descriptions.collectedfrom: Information about the sources from which the record has been collected.

organizations.description: Organizations include companies, research centers or institutions involved as project partners or as responsible of operating data sources. Information about organizations are collected from funder databases like CORDA, registries of data sources like OpenDOAR and re3Data, and CRIS systems, as being related to projects or data sources.

column-descriptions.legalShortName: The legal name in short form of the organization.
column-descriptions.legalName: The legal name of the organization.
column-descriptions.alternativeNames: Alternative names that identify the organization.
column-descriptions.country: The country where the organization is located.
column-descriptions.id: The OpenAIRE id for the organization, created according to the [OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/pids-and-identifiers).
column-descriptions.pids: The list of persistent identifiers for the organization.

datasources.description:
OpenAIRE entity instances are created out of data collected from various data sources of different kinds, such as publication repositories, research data archives, CRIS systems, funder databases, etc. Data sources export information packages (e.g., XML records, HTTP responses, RDF data, JSON) that may contain information on one or more of such entities and possibly relationships between them.
For example, a metadata record about a project carries information for the creation of a Project entity and its participants (as Organization entities). It is important, once each piece of information is extracted from such packages and inserted into the OpenAIRE information space as an entity, for such pieces to keep provenance information relative to the originating data source. This is to give visibility to the data source, but also to enable the reconstruction of the very same piece of information if problems arise.

schema.journal: STRUCT("name" VARCHAR, issnPrinted VARCHAR, issnOnline VARCHAR, issnLinking VARCHAR, ep VARCHAR, iss VARCHAR, sp VARCHAR, vol VARCHAR, edition VARCHAR, conferencePlace VARCHAR, conferenceDate DATE)

column-descriptions.id: The OpenAIRE id of the data source, created according to the [OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/pids-and-identifiers).
column-descriptions.originalIds: The list of original identifiers associated to the datasource.
column-descriptions.pids: The persistent identifiers for the datasource.
column-descriptions.type: The datasource type; see the vocabulary [dnet:datasource_typologies](https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:datasource_typologies).
column-descriptions.openaireCompatibility: The OpenAIRE compatibility of the ingested research products, indicates which guidelines they are compliant according to the vocabulary [dnet:datasourceCompatibilityLevel](https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:datasourceCompatibilityLevel).
column-descriptions.officialName: The official name of the datasource.
column-descriptions.englishName: The English name of the datasource.
column-descriptions.websiteUrl: The URL of the website of the datasource.
column-descriptions.logoUrl: The URL of the logo for the datasource.
column-descriptions.dateOfValidation: The date of validation against the OpenAIRE guidelines for the datasource records.
column-descriptions.subjects: List of subjects associated to the datasource
column-descriptions.languages: The languages present in the data source's content, as defined by OpenDOAR.
column-descriptions.contentTypes: Types of content in the data source, as defined by OpenDOAR
column-descriptions.releaseStartDate: Releasing date of the data source, as defined by re3data.org.
column-descriptions.releaseEndDate: Date when the data source went offline or stopped ingesting new research data. As defined by re3data.org
column-descriptions.missionStatementUrl: The URL of a mission statement describing the designated community of the data source. As defined by re3data.org
column-descriptions.accessRights: Type of access to the data source, as defined by re3data.org. Possible values: { open, restricted, closed }.
column-descriptions.uploadRights: Type of data upload, as defined by re3data.org; one of { open, restricted, closed }.
column-descriptions.databaseAccessRestriction: Access restrictions to the research data repository. Allowed values are: { feeRequired, registration, other }. This field only applies for re3data data source; see [re3data schema specification](https://gfzpublic.gfz-potsdam.de/rest/items/item_758898_6/component/file_775891/content) for more details.
column-descriptions.dataUploadRestriction: Upload restrictions applied by the datasource, as defined by re3data.org. One of { feeRequired, registration, other }. This field only applies for re3data data source; see [re3data schema specification](https://gfzpublic.gfz-potsdam.de/rest/items/item_758898_6/component/file_775891/content) for more details.
column-descriptions.versioning: Whether the research data repository supports versioning: yes if the data source supports versioning, no otherwise. This field only applies for re3data data source; see [re3data schema specification](https://gfzpublic.gfz-potsdam.de/rest/items/item_758898_6/component/file_775891/content) for more details.
column-descriptions.citationGuidelineUrl: The URL of the data source providing information on how to cite its items. The DataCite citation format is recommended (http://www.datacite.org/whycitedata). This field only applies for re3data data source; see [re3data schema specification](https://gfzpublic.gfz-potsdam.de/rest/items/item_758898_6/component/file_775891/content) for more details.
column-descriptions.pidSystems: The persistent identifier system that is used by the data source. As defined by re3data.org.
column-descriptions.certificates: The certificate, seal or standard the data source complies with. As defined by re3data.org.
column-descriptions.policies: Policies of the data source, as defined in OpenDOAR.
column-descriptions.journal: Information about the journal, if this data source is of type Journal.

projects.description: Of crucial interest to OpenAIRE is also the identification of the funders (e.g. European Commission, WellcomeTrust, FCT Portugal, NWO The Netherlands) that co-funded the projects that have led to a given research product. Projects are characterized by a list of funding streams (e.g. FP7, H2020 for the EC), which identify the strands of fundings. Funding streams can be nested to form a tree of sub-funding streams.

schema.title: VARCHAR
schema.fundings: STRUCT(shortName VARCHAR, "name" VARCHAR, jurisdiction VARCHAR, fundingStream STRUCT(id VARCHAR, description VARCHAR))[]
schema.granted: STRUCT(currency VARCHAR, totalCost DOUBLE, fundedAmount DOUBLE)

column-descriptions.id: Main entity identifier, created according to the [OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/pids-and-identifiers).
column-descriptions.code: Τhe grant agreement code of the project.
column-descriptions.title: Project's title.
column-descriptions.startDate: The start year of the project.
column-descriptions.endDate: The end year pf the project.
column-descriptions.callIdentifier: The identifier of the research call.
column-descriptions.granted: The money granted to the project.
column-descriptions.h2020Programmes: The H2020 programme funding the project.

relations.description: metadata records about relations between entities in the graph.

column-descriptions.provenance: Indicates the process that produced (or provided) the information.
column-descriptions.relType: Represent the semantics of the relationship between two nodes of the graph.
column-descriptions.source: OpenAIRE identifier of the node in the graph.
column-descriptions.target: OpenAIRE identifier of the node in the graph.
column-descriptions.validated: Indicates weather or not the relationship was validated.
column-descriptions.validationDate: Indicates the validation date of the relationship - applies only when the validated flag is set to true.

communities_infrastructures.description:
Research communities and research initiatives are intended as groups of people with a common research intent and can be of two types: ​research initiatives or ​research communities​:
Research initiatives are intended to capture a view of the information space that is "research impact"-oriented, i.e. all products generated due to my research initiative;
Research communities the latter “research activity” oriented, i.e. all products that may be of interest or related to my research initiative.
For example, the organizations supporting a research infrastructure fall in the first category, while the researchers involved in a discipline fall in the second.

column-descriptions.description: Description of the research community/research infrastructure
column-descriptions.id: The OpenAIRE id for the community/research infrastructure, created according to the [OpenAIRE entity identifier and PID mapping policy](https://graph.openaire.eu/docs/data-model/pids-and-identifiers).
column-descriptions.name: The long name of the community.
column-descriptions.type: The type of the community; one of { Research Community, Research infrastructure }.
column-descriptions.subjects: The list of the subjects associated to the research community (only appies to research communities).
column-descriptions.zenodoCommunity: The URL of the Zenodo community associated to the Research community/Research infrastructure.
